column4: hey guys, I have an old 800 MHz PC here with Win ME, can you guys tell me a way of installing UBUNTU on it? it seems not to load from the normal CROM . . :(
is your BIOS configured to boot from a CD?
- yeah of course, I am booting to the cd, and trying to load the OS from CDROM install but it just doesnt load up....
I just wanna kill WINME and install Linux.... :(
just doesn't work doesn't help, what happens exactly?
- it just goes to load up Xwindows to boot but doesnt get far past that screen.... I am running a Maxrox Millenium Video card, dont know if thats a prob...
- It seems to halt and load forever on Xwindows
so it IS installed, but X isn't working
- no it is booting from CDROM to the CDROM version but wont boot INTO X at all :(
so you're using the live cd?
correct. sorry I forgot to say that!
- is there a way I can just start an install from Windows which will FORCE itself onto this pc? and can you install it onto a FAT32 partition?
iirc the live CD doesn't install. you need an install CD. you can probably install to a fat32 partition, but it'll be ugly
- what do you mean by ugly? and why wont the LIVE cd work?
ugly as in the opposite of pretty, and i don't know.
